sections.title: Milestone Priority
body: - Milestone 1: Enable gameplay for the initial Manny office scene (load, navigate, interact).
- All active work should unblock first-playable experience before tackling broader engine polish.

sections.title: Current Direction
body: - Stabilise codec3 decoding so Manny's office colour plates and `.zbm` depth stay faithful in engine captures.
- Stand up a minimal game loop that loads Manny's office scripts, hooks input, and keeps hotspots functional.

sections.title: Active Threads
body: - Validate room bootstrap (scene assets, walkboxes, dialogues) inside the modern runtime and log gaps to close.
- Confirm Manny's office depth metadata drives correct draw ordering once interactions kick in.

sections.title: Next Steps
body: 1. Demo entering Manny's office from boot with walk-able Manny and one interactive hotspot.
2. Lock in regression coverage for codec3 colour + depth paths so the scene stays stable once playable.

workstreams.description: Load Manny's office and basic gameplay loop
workstreams.prompt: Objective: wire up the startup path that enters Manny's office with scripts, walkboxes, and camera state so we can move Manny and trigger baseline interactions. Capture blockers that prevent first-playable and co-ordinate fixes quickly.

Objective: ensure Manny can interact with a representative hotspot (e.g. pneumatic tube or desk) including dialogue playback, so the milestone demo feels alive. Trim scope to essentials and defer complex puzzle logic until after the first playable.

Objective: keep Manny's office rendering faithful by matching codec3 behaviour between colour `.bm` plates and `.zbm` depth maps. Ensure seeded windows mirror the original engine, expose depth ranges for validation, and land regression tests or tooling that prevent the half-black regression from returning.
